intro: Micranthes razshivinii, commonly known as the Razshivin's micranthes, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
